Package com.tloj.game.game

package com.tloj.game.game
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    com.tloj.game
     
  • Class
    Description
    Attack
    An abstract class that represents an attack in the game.
    Attacks are actions that can be performed by CombatEntities.
    They can be used to deal damage to other CombatEntities.
    This design respects modularity and scalability, as the action of the attack is its own class that encapsulates different data like
    the attacker, target and all different damages/defenses and allows for complex attack mechanics in the game to coexist.
    CharacterObserver
    An interface that represents an observer of the game's characters.
    A class extending this interface can register itself as an observer and receive notifications from the Character object
    Controller
    Controller fa√ßade class to handle the game state and user input
    It uses the Singleton pattern to ensure only one instance of the Controller class is created
    It uses the Command pattern to handle the different game commands
    It uses the Factory pattern to create different Characters based on the user's choice
    Coordinates
    Represents the coordinates used to move and initialize objects in the game map.
    Coordinates.Direction
    Represents the direction of movement.
    Dice
    Represents a dice in the game
    A dice is a random number generator with a minimum and maximum value
    The dice can be rolled to get a random number between the minimum and maximum values
    Floor
    Represents a floor in the game.
    Game
    The Game class represents the main game logic.
    It controls player movement, interactions with rooms and entities, combat, inventory management, saving and loading game data, and more.
    GameIndex
    A utility class for managing the index of saved games.
    GameState
    Represents the different states of the game
    The game can be in one of these states at any given time
    The state of the game determines what the player can do and what the game will do next
    MobAttack
    Represents an Attack performed by a mob.
    PlayerAttack
    Represents an Attack performed by the player.
    PlayerRoomVisitor
    PlayerRoomVisitor class to handle the visit different types of rooms in the game.
